instruction: [STATUS: OK] How often should I calibrate my EC sensor?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calibrate EC sensors weekly with standard solutions at 1.4 and 2.8 mS/cm. Perform full recalibration monthly for accuracy within ±0.1 mS/cm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] My pH sensor shows drift after 2 weeks. What's the maintenance schedule?
output: [STATUS: OK] Clean pH electrode weekly with 0.1M HCl solution. Replace electrolyte monthly and full sensor replacement after 12-18 months of continuous use.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Temperature sensor reads 2°C higher than reference. How to adjust?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the optimal height for humidity sensors in tomato greenhouse?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] CO2 sensor shows erratic readings. How to diagnose?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How many PAR sensors needed for 1000m² greenhouse?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 4-6 PAR sensors per 1000m², spaced in grid pattern. Add 2 sensors near vents for light uniformity monitoring.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sensor data shows spikes every 30 minutes. What's causing this?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] When to replace quantum sensors for LED supplemental lighting?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to validate temperature sensor accuracy?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Optimal sensor polling interval for tomato climate control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] My wireless sensors lose connection frequently. How to improve?

output: [STATUS: OK] Activate fog when VPD >1.4 kPa and temp >26°C. Run 30-second cycles with 5-minute intervals, monitor RH response.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure heating priority during cold nights?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set heating as priority 1, maintain 16°C minimum. Disable CO2 injection and reduce ventilation to retain heat.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for LED supplemental lighting control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate when PAR <200 μmol/m²/s, target 15-20 mol/m²/day DLI. Dim gradually over 30 minutes at sunrise/sunset.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up irrigation timing based on radiation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Irrigate when cumulative radiation reaches 1.5 MJ/m². Adjust volume 1.5-2.5 ml/plant/Wm⁻² based on growth stage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic prevents condensation on plants?
output: [STATUS: OK] When RH >85% and temp drops, activate minimum heating to 2°C above dewpoint. Increase air circulation to 0.3 m/s.
source: Bailey and Chalabi 1994 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automatic EC adjustment in fertigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure drain EC, adjust stock solution injection ±0.2 mS/cm to maintain 2.5-3.0 target. Correct every 2-3 irrigations.
source: Rouphael and Colla 2005 - European Journal of Horticultural Science

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for CO2 control with natural ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop CO2 when ventilation >15% open or wind speed >3 m/s. Resume when vents close for 10 minutes continuously.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up adaptive control for changing crop stages?
output: [STATUS: OK] Define 4 growth profiles: seedling, vegetative, flowering, fruiting. Adjust setpoints automatically based on days after transplant.
source: Tchamitchian et al. 2006 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control parameters for thermal screen management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close screens when outside temp <12°C and solar radiation <50 W/m². Open when inside temp exceeds 24°C or at sunrise +1h.
source: Bot and Van de Braak 1995 - Acta Horticulturae

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure pump control for hydroponic systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Run pumps 5-15 min per cycle, 6-12 times daily. Adjust frequency based on temperature (add 1 cycle per 2°C above 24°C).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What logic for coordinating heating and ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Disable heating when vents >5% open. Close vents before activating heat. Use 2-minute transition delay between modes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up sunrise temperature boost control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Increase setpoint by 2-3°C starting 1 hour before sunrise for 2 hours. Promotes photosynthesis and reduces disease risk.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for mixing valves in heating?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 3-way mixing valve with 0-10V control. Set supply water 45-55°C, adjust flow based on PID output signal.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure pH dosing pump control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure pH every 5 minutes, dose acid when pH >6.0, dose base when pH <5.5. Use 2-second pulses, wait 3 minutes.
source: Savvas and Adamidis 1999 - Journal of Horticultural Science

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated misting system?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate when leaf temp exceeds air temp by 2°C or VPD >1.5 kPa. Mist 10-second bursts every 10 minutes.
source: Kittas et al. 2003 - Agricultural Water Management

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up circulation fan control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Run continuously at 30% speed baseline, increase to 60% when temp difference >2°C between zones or RH >80%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for roof vent rain closure?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close vents immediately when rain detected. Keep closed 15 minutes after rain stops to prevent water dripping inside.
source: Bailey 1985 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure setpoint ramping for gradual changes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Implement linear ramping at 0.5°C per 15 minutes maximum. Prevents shock and maintains stable plant metabolism.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for high-pressure sodium lamp control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Operate when PAR <150 μmol/m²/s, run 16-18 hours maximum. Implement 10-minute warm-up, avoid on/off cycling <1 hour.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up wind-speed responsive ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Reduce vent opening by 20% when wind >5 m/s, close lee-side vents completely. Prevents cold drafts and structural stress.
source: Boulard et al. 1997 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for root zone heating?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain substrate temperature 18-20°C using floor heating. Control independently from air temperature with ±0.5°C precision.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure backup control when primary sensor fails?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use redundant sensors with automatic failover. If primary fails, switch to secondary after 3 consecutive invalid readings.
source: Sigrimis et al. 2001 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated drain collection control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Start drain collection after 15% leaching achieved. Measure EC and pH, adjust next irrigation based on drain values.
source: Sonneveld and Voogt 2009 - Plant Nutrition of Greenhouse Crops

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up light-dependent heating control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Increase temperature setpoint 0.5°C per 100 W/m² radiation. Maintains optimal photosynthesis with changing light levels.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for exhaust fans with evaporative cooling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate pad-and-fan when temp >28°C and outside RH <60%. Run exhaust at 60 air changes per hour.
source: Sethi and Sharma 2007 - Energy Conversion and Management

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated nutrient dosing systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Dose fertilizer concentrate at 1:100 ratio. Adjust based on EC feedback with proportional control (0.1 mS/cm error = 5% adjustment).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated CO2 burner control?

source: Heij and De Lint 1995 - Acta Horticulturae

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated screen control for multiple layers?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for chiller systems in cooling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate chiller when cooling load >80% capacity of natural ventilation. Maintain supply water 12-14°C for fan coils.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure valve sequencing in irrigation zones?
output: [STATUS: OK] Irrigate zones sequentially with 1-minute overlap. Monitor pressure; if drops >10%, reduce active zones or increase pump speed.
source: Hoffman et al. 2007 - Microirrigation for Crop Production

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated blackout curtain control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close curtains at civil twilight (sun -6° below horizon), open at desired photoperiod length. Use astronomical clock for precision.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up variable frequency drive for fan control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Configure 0-10V analog input for speed control. Operate 30-100% speed range (below 30% reduces efficiency and causes hunting).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated gutter drainage?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open gutter drains when rainfall >10mm or forecast predicts heavy rain. Maintain 2cm water depth maximum in gutters.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated fogging for propagation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 85-95% RH during rooting. Fog 5-second bursts every 3-5 minutes, adjust based on VPD and light intensity.
source: Hartmann et al. 2010 - Plant Propagation: Principles and Practices

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated side-vent control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open side vents 5 minutes after roof vents reach 30%. Close side vents first when temperature drops. Prevent cross-drafts.
source: Boulard and Baille 1995 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated boiler control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain boiler supply temp 70-80°C using outdoor reset control. Modulate burner based on return water temperature.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated water treatment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor source water EC and pH continuously. Activate RO system when EC >0.8 mS/cm, acid injection when pH >7.5.
source: Ayers and Westcot 1985 - FAO Irrigation and Drainage Paper

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated assimilation lighting control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Supplement to DLI target of 17 mol/m²/day. Track daily integral, adjust intensity and duration to meet target by day end.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated steam sterilization control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Heat substrate to 70°C for 30 minutes using steam injection. Monitor temperature at multiple depths, cool gradually over 24 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up priority-based equipment scheduling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Priority 1: Safety systems. Priority 2: Temperature control. Priority 3: Humidity/CO2. Priority 4: Irrigation. Priority 5: Lighting.
source: Sigrimis et al. 2000 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated dehumidifier operation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate when RH >80% and temp <20°C (ventilation ineffective). Set drain pump cycle every 4 hours or when tank 80% full.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated fertigation injection pumps?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use positive displacement dosing pumps at fixed ratio (1:100). Verify injection with EC monitoring; adjust if deviation >0.3 mS/cm.
source: Hochmuth 2012 - University of Florida IFAS Extension

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated shade retention control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Keep shade deployed if inside temp remains >26°C despite deployment. Retract only when radiation drops <300 W/m².

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated backup generator control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Auto-start generator within 10 seconds of power loss. Maintain critical systems: circulation fans, irrigation pumps, alarms.
source: IEEE 2020 - Emergency and Standby Power Systems

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated high-wire crop lowering?
output: [STATUS: OK] Lower plants 40-50cm weekly to maintain working height 1.5-1.8m. Use motorized system at 5cm/minute, avoid stem damage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated UV sterilization for irrigation water?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install UV lamp with 30 mJ/cm² dose minimum. Monitor lamp hours, replace at 9000 hours or when intensity drops below 80%.
source: Ehret et al. 2001 - Canadian Journal of Plant Science

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated pollination fans?
output: [STATUS: OK] Run oscillating fans 2-3 times daily during flowering (10:00, 13:00, 16:00) for 15 minutes at 0.5 m/s air speed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated substrate temperature monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Place sensors 10cm depth in root zone. Alert if temp <16°C or >24°C. Adjust heating pipes or cooling as needed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated curtain gap control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 5-10cm gap when energy screens deployed to allow moisture escape. Close gap fully only when outside temp <5°C.
source: Bailey and Seginer 1989 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated filter backwash cycles?
output: [STATUS: OK] Backwash sand filters every 24 hours or when pressure differential exceeds 0.5 bar. Run reverse flow 3-5 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated shade screen under windy conditions?
output: [STATUS: OK] Retract shade screens when wind speed >10 m/s to prevent mechanical damage. Re-deploy when wind drops below 7 m/s for 10 minutes.
source: Impron et al. 2007 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated sump pump control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate pump when water level reaches 15cm depth. Run until level drops to 5cm. Include redundant float switch for safety.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated thermal blanket deployment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy blanket when heat loss >150 W/m² or outside temp <8°C. Retract when solar radiation >50 W/m² in morning.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated grow light intensity dimming?
output: [STATUS: OK] Dim LEDs proportionally to natural light. When PAR >200 μmol/m²/s outside, reduce supplemental by 50%. Target total 400 μmol/m²/s.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated condensate collection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Collect condensate from cooling coils, measure EC <0.3 mS/cm before reusing. Discard first 10L daily to avoid contamination.
source: Van Os et al. 2008 - Acta Horticulturae

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated stock tank level monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use ultrasonic level sensor, alert when <20% capacity. Auto-refill to 80% capacity with controlled fill rate 100 L/min.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated air inlet louver control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open louvers proportionally to exhaust fan speed. Maintain 10% more inlet area than exhaust to create negative pressure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated rockwool saturation control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 70-80% saturation. Irrigate when drops to 65%, stop when reaches 80%. Use weighing lysimeters or WC sensors.
source: Raviv and Lieth 2008 - Soilless Culture Theory and Practice

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated pesticide injection system?
output: [STATUS: OK] Dilute at 1:200 ratio through injection pump. Run through system for 10 minutes, then flush with clean water 5 minutes.
source: Matthews et al. 2014 - Pesticide Application Methods

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated door closure during treatment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Auto-lock doors when CO2 >5000ppm or during fumigation. Display warning lights, require manual override after 2 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated capillary mat irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 2-3cm water depth in mat system. Refill when depth <1.5cm. Monitor EC in mat, flush weekly to prevent salt buildup.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated sulfur burner for mildew prevention?
output: [STATUS: OK] Burn sulfur at 5g/100m³ during night when RH >75%. Operate 2-4 hours, ensure no plant contact, ventilate before morning.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated boom sprayer?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set boom height 50cm above canopy, spray pressure 3 bar, speed 0.3 m/s. Apply 200-300 L/ha with calibrated nozzles.
source: Nuyttens et al. 2007 - Transactions of ASABE

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated gutter heating control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate gutter heating when outside temp <2°C to prevent ice formation. Maintain gutter temp 5-8°C, disable when temp >5°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated beneficial insect release?
output: [STATUS: OK] Program automated dispensers to release predators weekly. Encarsia: 3-5/m² on Mondays, Phytoseiulus: 5-10/m² on Thursdays.
source: Van Lenteren 2012 - Journal of Plant Diseases and Protection

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated humidity sensor drift compensation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calibrate RH sensors monthly using salt solutions (75.3% at 25°C with NaCl). Auto-adjust readings if drift >3%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated pressure tank cycling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain system pressure 2.0-2.5 bar using pressure tank. Activate pump at 2.0 bar, stop at 2.5 bar. Check bladder quarterly.
source: Camp et al. 2000 - Water Distribution Systems Handbook

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated root zone oxygen monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor dissolved oxygen in substrate solution, maintain >6 mg/L. If drops below 4 mg/L, increase drain percentage to 30%.
source: Morard and Silvestre 1996 - Journal of Plant Nutrition

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated screen position feedback?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install potentiometers on screen motors. Verify position accuracy ±2%. If deviation >5%, recalibrate end-stop positions.
source: Bailey et al. 1993 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated air mixing for CO2 distribution?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install horizontal airflow fans 3m apart at crop height. Run continuously at low speed (0.3 m/s) when CO2 injecting.
source: Fernández and Bailey 1992 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated drain valve sequencing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open drain valves 2 minutes after irrigation stops. Keep open 5 minutes to allow complete drainage. Monitor drain volume.
source: Sonneveld and Straver 1994 - Plant and Soil

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated light sensor cleaning?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule sensor cleaning notification monthly. Compare to reference sensor; if difference >10%, clean dome with distilled water.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated grow bag weight monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Weigh sample bags hourly. When weight drops 10% from saturation, trigger irrigation. Target 5-10% drainage per cycle.
source: Carmassi et al. 2005 - Journal of Horticultural Science and Biotechnology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated manifold pressure regulation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install pressure regulator at manifold input. Maintain 1.5±0.1 bar throughout system. Alert if pressure varies >0.2 bar.
source: Keller and Bliesner 1990 - Sprinkle and Trickle Irrigation

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated thermal mass utilization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Store excess heat in water tanks during day (temp >30°C), release at night via heat exchangers. Maintain tank 20-50°C range.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated biofilter regeneration cycles?
output: [STATUS: OK] Backflush biofilter every 7 days with clean water. Run reverse flow 10 minutes at 150% normal flow rate to remove debris.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated substrate EC trending?
output: [STATUS: OK] Log substrate EC every 2 hours. If increases >0.5 mS/cm daily, increase leaching to 20%. If decreases, reduce feed EC by 0.2.
source: De Rijck and Schrevens 1998 - Scientia Horticulturae

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated wind direction compensation for vents?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close windward vents partially (50%) during high wind. Open leeward vents fully to create controlled airflow pattern.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated fruit temperature monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor fruit surface temp with IR sensors. If fruit temp exceeds air temp by >3°C, increase shading and ventilation.
source: Jones et al. 2002 - Journal of Experimental Botany

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated zone valve pressure balancing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install pressure sensors per zone. Balance flow using automatic balancing valves to maintain equal pressure ±0.1 bar across all zones.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated emergency shutdown sequence?
output: [STATUS: OK] On critical failure: Close vents, stop CO2, activate backup cooling/heating, send alerts. Maintain safe temp 15-30°C until manual reset.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated rain sensor override for irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Skip irrigation cycle if rain >5mm detected. Resume normal schedule 24 hours after rain stops or when substrate WC <70%.
source: Muñoz-Carpena et al. 2002 - Journal of Irrigation and Drainage Engineering

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated pump soft-start?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use VFD to ramp pump from 0-100% over 10 seconds. Prevents water hammer and extends pump life. Ramp down over 5 seconds.
source: Thorley 2004 - Fluid Transients in Pipeline Systems

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated CO2 sensor span verification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Verify CO2 sensor against 800ppm calibration gas monthly. Auto-adjust span if deviation >50ppm. Replace sensor if drift >100ppm.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated leak detection in irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor flow rate continuously. If flow persists >5 min after valves close or exceeds normal by 20%, trigger leak alarm.
source: Puust et al. 2010 - Journal of Water Supply Research and Technology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated shade screen pocketing prevention?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated substrate temperature differential?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain substrate 2-3°C warmer than air temp during fruiting stage. Adjust pipe heating to achieve differential based on growth stage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated motor overload protection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set thermal overload at 115% rated current. Auto-restart after 5 minutes cooling if overload trips. After 3 trips, lock out and alert.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] High temperature alert triggered. What automatic actions?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Low temperature and high humidity alarm. Response?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Irrigation pump failure detected. What backup protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Switch to redundant pump automatically within 10 seconds. Alert maintenance team. If backup fails, activate emergency hand-watering protocol.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EC sensor reading exceeds 5.0 mS/cm threshold. Action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] CO2 level exceeds safety limit 1500ppm. Response?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] pH reading drops to 4.2 in nutrient solution. Alert action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Humidity exceeds 90% for 2 hours. Automated response?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Temperature sensor shows erratic readings ±5°C fluctuations. Protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Switch to backup sensor, flag primary sensor for calibration. Continue operation using secondary sensor. Schedule maintenance within 24 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Light sensor reading drops suddenly to 5000lux at noon. Action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Water flow meter shows 50% reduction in flow rate. Response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check filter differential pressure. If >0.5 bar, initiate immediate backwash. Check pump operation and inspect for line blockages or leaks.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Drain water EC is 1.0 mS/cm higher than supply. Alert interpretation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Critical heat stress alert at 42°C. Emergency protocol?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Substrate moisture sensor reads 0% (likely failure). Action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] VPD calculated at 2.5 kPa, exceeding 1.5 kPa threshold. Response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate misting system, reduce temperature 2°C, increase humidity via ventilation reduction. Target VPD 0.8-1.2 kPa for optimal growth.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Boiler flame failure detected. Automated safety response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Shut off gas supply immediately, lockout system. Activate backup electric heating if available. Alert operator for immediate service call.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Screen motor draws excessive current (150% rated). Alert action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Multiple sensors offline simultaneously. System integrity alert?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Vent motors not responding to control signals. Emergency protocol?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Drain percentage drops from 20% to 5% suddenly. Alert interpretation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Indicates possible dripper clogging or pump malfunction. Check system pressure and inspect emitters. Increase irrigation time by 30% temporarily.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Heating system not responding, temp dropping to 10°C. Action?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What integration method for combining sensor and weather data?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate multiple climate zones in single greenhouse?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate fertigation with substrate moisture sensors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate pest monitoring cameras with climate control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating weather forecasts into control logic?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate CO2 supply monitoring with usage optimization?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to sync fertigation schedule with plant growth model?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate lighting control with DLI tracking?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate mobile app notifications with alert system?
output: [STATUS: OK] Send critical alarms (temp >30°C, system failure) via SMS immediately. Non-critical alerts via app notification. Log all events.
source: Kaloxylos et al. 2012 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate thermal imaging with heating distribution control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating water quality monitoring with treatment systems?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate harvest data with irrigation management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate soil/substrate testing with fertigation adjustments?
output: [STATUS: OK] Lab test substrate every 2 weeks. Compare to sensor data. Adjust feed formulation if lab shows >20% deviation from sensor readings.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate ventilation control with biological pest management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Limit ventilation to <30% opening during beneficial insect release days. Prevents wind dispersal. Resume normal control after 24 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate production planning with environmental setpoints?
output: [STATUS: OK] Adjust DIF and temperature based on target harvest date. Increase temp 2°C to accelerate ripening by 5-7 days if needed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate root zone temperature control with air temperature?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain substrate temp 2°C above air temp during vegetative growth. Use independent pipe heating circuit controlled by substrate sensors.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating employee task scheduling with climate events?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule manual tasks (pruning, harvest) during optimal VPD 0.8-1.2 kPa. Avoid when extreme temps require full climate system operation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate electricity pricing with energy-intensive operations?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pre-cool/heat during off-peak hours (22:00-06:00). Store thermal energy in water tanks. Reduce supplemental lighting during peak rates.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate spectral light sensors with LED control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure R:FR ratio continuously. Maintain 1.2-1.5 for compact growth. Adjust LED spectrum dynamically: increase blue when R:FR >1.8.
source: Smith 1982 - Annual Review of Plant Physiology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate drainage recycling with disease risk assessment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Recycle drain only when pathogen risk low (RH <75%, no disease symptoms). Disinfect with UV 40 mJ/cm² before reuse.
source: Ehret et al. 2001 - Canadian Journal of Plant Science

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate multiple control algorithms hierarchically?
output: [STATUS: OK] Level 1: Safety overrides. Level 2: Setpoint optimization. Level 3: Equipment scheduling. Level 4: Energy optimization. Prioritize top-down.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate plant growth cameras with irrigation decisions?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze daily canopy images for growth rate. If growth rate drops >15%, increase irrigation 10% and check EC levels.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating historical data with predictive control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use machine learning on 2+ years data to predict optimal setpoints. Update model weekly. Compare predicted vs actual yield monthly.
source: Jung et al. 2018 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate leaf wetness sensors with disease prevention protocols?
output: [STATUS: OK] If leaf wetness >4 consecutive hours, increase heating 2°C and air circulation 50%. Preventively spray if persists >6 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate actuator runtime tracking with maintenance scheduling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Log motor hours for all equipment. Schedule maintenance: pumps every 2000h, fans every 5000h, valves every 10000 cycles.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate backup power capacity with critical load prioritization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Size generator at 60% total load. Priority: circulation fans (30%), irrigation (20%), heating/cooling (30%), monitoring (10%), lights (10%).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate sensor redundancy for critical measurements?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 3 sensors for critical parameters (temp, RH, EC). Use median value. Flag sensor if deviates >10% from median for >1 hour.
source: Sigrimis et al. 2000 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate crop load estimation with nutrient management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count fruit weekly, estimate total load kg/m². Increase EC by 0.3 mS/cm per 5 kg/m² fruit load above baseline of 15 kg/m².

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating manual overrides with automatic control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Allow manual override for 2 hours max before auto-resume. Log all overrides with timestamp and operator ID. Review weekly for patterns.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate water usage tracking with sustainability reporting?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure total water input and drain output daily. Calculate water use efficiency (L per kg fruit). Target <60 L/kg with 95% recirculation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate evapotranspiration calculations with irrigation control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate hourly ET using Penman-Monteith equation from climate data. Irrigate when cumulative ET reaches 1.5-2.0 mm equivalent.
source: Bailey et al. 1993 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate economic models with production optimization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Model revenue (€/kg × yield) vs costs (energy, CO2, labor). Optimize setpoints for maximum profit margin, not just maximum yield.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate carbon footprint tracking with greenhouse operations?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor energy use, CO2 consumption, transport. Calculate kg CO2eq per kg tomato. Target <1.5 kg CO2eq/kg fruit with renewable energy.
source: Torrellas et al. 2012 - Journal of Cleaner Production

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated nutrient solution temperature control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain nutrient solution at 18-22°C using heat exchangers. Cool when temp >24°C, heat when <16°C. Monitor root zone oxygen levels.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated air circulation pattern control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Program fans for horizontal airflow at 0.5-1.0 m/s. Alternate direction every 30 minutes. Increase to 1.5 m/s during high humidity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated humidity sensor drift correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare sensors against saturated salt standard monthly. Apply correction factor if drift >2%. Replace sensor if drift >5%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated mist frequency adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate misting from VPD: <0.6 kPa no mist, 0.6-1.2 every 30 min, 1.2-1.8 every 15 min, >1.8 every 5 min.
source: Montero et al. 2013 - Agricultural Water Management

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated shade screen gap management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 10-15cm gap at edges when deployed for moisture venting. Close gap fully when RH <60% for maximum shading effect.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated fan staging control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stage 1: 25% fans at 26°C. Stage 2: 50% fans at 27°C. Stage 3: 75% fans at 28°C. Stage 4: 100% fans at 29°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated irrigation based on plant weight?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install load cells under sample plants. Trigger irrigation when daily weight loss reaches 8-10%. Target 3-5% drainage per event.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated thermal screen phasing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open screens in 4 steps over 20 minutes in morning. Close in reverse sequence in evening. Prevents sudden temperature changes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated CO2 dosing with demand control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure actual CO2 uptake rate. Adjust injection to maintain 800ppm ±50. Reduce dosing when photosynthesis rate drops <70%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated pipe heating zone control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide greenhouse into 4-6 zones with independent valve control. Adjust each zone ±2°C from setpoint based on local sensors.
source: Bailey and Seginer 1990 - Journal of Agricultural Engineering Research

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated drain water disinfection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Route drain through UV reactor (40 mJ/cm²) or slow sand filter before reuse. Monitor pathogen levels weekly, EC/pH continuously.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated mixing tank preparation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Auto-fill to 90% capacity, add concentrates sequentially with 2-minute mixing intervals. Final 10-minute mix before use.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated LED spectrum adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Adjust blue:red ratio based on growth stage. Vegetative 30:70, flowering 20:80, fruiting 25:75. Transition gradually over 3 days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated greenhouse wash-down system?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule wash-down monthly. Use automated sprayers with 200 bar pressure. Apply cleaning solution for 10 minutes, rinse 5 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated dewpoint tracking control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate dewpoint continuously from temp and RH. Maintain surface temps 2-3°C above dewpoint to prevent condensation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated air exchange rate?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate required air changes from CO2 balance. Minimum 0.5 changes/hour, increase to 30-60 changes/hour for cooling.
source: Boulard and Draoui 1995 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated sensor calibration reminder?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule calibration alerts: pH/EC monthly, temp/RH quarterly, CO2 semi-annually, light sensors annually. Log all calibrations.
source: Sigrimis et al. 2013 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated root zone EC management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Target substrate EC 0.5-0.8 mS/cm higher than supply. Adjust feed EC ±0.3 when deviation >0.5 from target for 24 hours.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated supplemental CO2 with enrichment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Enrich to 1000ppm during high light (PAR >300). Reduce to 600ppm at low light. Stop when vents open >25% or during application.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated pipe heating distribution?
output: [STATUS: OK] Allocate 60% heat to growing pipes (under crop), 30% to rail pipes (walkways), 10% to overhead. Adjust based on outside temp.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated water tank level monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use float switches at 20%, 50%, 80% levels. Auto-refill when drops below 20%. Alarm if fill doesn't reach 50% in 30 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated fog system pressure control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 70-100 bar pressure for optimal droplet size 10-20 microns. Use VFD pump control to adjust pressure based on nozzle count.
source: Kittas et al. 2001 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated fertigation tank refill?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor stock tank levels. Auto-mix new batch when level drops to 25%. Prepare concentrate A and B tanks separately to prevent precipitation.
source: Jones 2014 - Complete Guide for Growing Plants Hydroponically

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated screen deployment priority?
output: [STATUS: OK] Priority 1: Energy screen for night heat retention. Priority 2: Shade screen for day cooling. Priority 3: Blackout for photoperiod control.
source: Papadakis et al. 2000 - Journal of Agricultural Engineering Research

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated pump alternation schedule?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate between 2 pumps weekly to balance wear. Switch primary/backup roles. Log runtime hours for maintenance planning.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated airflow velocity control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain air velocity 0.3-0.5 m/s at canopy level during day. Reduce to 0.1-0.2 m/s at night. Measure at 1.5m height.
source: Kacira et al. 2004 - Transactions of ASAE

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated irrigation volume calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate volume from (ET + leaching target) × plant density. Adjust for weather: add 20% on hot days, reduce 30% on cloudy days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated heating curve adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use outdoor temperature reset: supply water temp = 80 - (1.5 × outdoor temp). Minimum 45°C, maximum 85°C.
source: ASHRAE 2021 - Heating and Cooling Load Calculations

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated screen closing speed?
output: [STATUS: OK] Close energy screens slowly (5% per minute) to avoid temperature shock. Shade screens can close faster (20% per minute).

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated substrate pH adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor drain pH continuously. If drain pH drifts >0.5 from target, adjust feed pH by 0.3 units. Wait 48 hours before next adjustment.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated water pressure monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor system pressure continuously. Alert if drops below 1.0 bar or exceeds 2.0 bar. Auto-adjust pump speed to maintain 1.5 bar.
source: Lamm et al. 2007 - Microirrigation for Crop Production

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated night ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open vents 10-15% at night when inside temp >2°C above outside and RH >85%. Close if temp drops below setpoint -1°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated injection pump calibration?
output: [STATUS: OK] Verify injection ratio monthly by measuring EC before/after injection. Adjust pump stroke if actual ratio deviates >5% from target.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated cooling pad wetness?
output: [STATUS: OK] Activate pad pumps 2 minutes before fans. Maintain pad wetness >80% during operation. Dry pads completely at night to prevent algae.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated light uniformity monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install 9 light sensors in 3×3 grid. Alert if coefficient of variation >15%. Adjust lamp positions or add supplemental lighting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated drain valve timing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open drain valves 5 minutes after irrigation ends. Keep open until flow stops + 2 minutes. Measure total drain volume for leaching calculation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated sensor averaging?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use weighted average from 3+ sensors per parameter. Weight by sensor age and location. Exclude outliers >2 standard deviations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated fogging system maintenance?
output: [STATUS: OK] Auto-flush nozzles daily for 30 seconds. Backflush filters every 8 hours. Replace nozzles when droplet size increases >20%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated CO2 usage tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Log CO2 consumption kg/hour and kg/kg fruit. Track injection hours and setpoint achievement %. Target <0.1 kg CO2 per kg fruit.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated vent position limiting?
output: [STATUS: OK] Limit vent opening based on wind speed: 100% at <3 m/s, 75% at 3-6 m/s, 50% at 6-10 m/s, 25% at >10 m/s.
source: Boulard et al. 1998 - Journal of Agricultural Engineering Research

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated temperature stratification detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure temp at 3 heights (floor, crop, roof). Alert if vertical gradient >3°C. Increase circulation to reduce stratification.
source: Fernández and Bailey 1994 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated substrate moisture distribution?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor moisture at 3 depths (5cm, 10cm, 15cm). Adjust irrigation duration if bottom layer remains <60% saturation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated energy curtain insulation tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate heat loss with/without screens deployed. Track energy savings kWh/day. Target 30-50% heating energy reduction with screens.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated fertigation batch preparation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pre-dilute concentrates 1:10 before main mixing. Add micronutrients last. Circulate solution 15 minutes, then verify EC/pH before use.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated air inlet damper control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Open inlet dampers proportionally with exhaust fans. Maintain slight negative pressure (-5 to -10 Pa). Prevent backdraft with interlock.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated heating coil valve control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 2-way modulating valves with 0-10V control. Adjust flow 0-100% based on PID output. Maintain minimum 10% flow to prevent freezing.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated irrigation flow rate monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install flow meters per zone. Alert if flow deviates >15% from baseline. Check for leaks if flow continues when valves closed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated condensate drainage?
output: [STATUS: OK] Drain condensate from cooling coils every 2 hours or when pan depth >5cm. Test EC before reuse; discard if EC >0.5 mS/cm.
source: Van Os et al. 2010 - Acta Horticulturae

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated motor soft-stop?
output: [STATUS: OK] Ramp down motors gradually over 5-10 seconds before stop. Reduces mechanical stress and extends equipment life by 20-30%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated pH dosing system lockout?
output: [STATUS: OK] Lock dosing if pH change >0.5 units in 10 minutes or total dose exceeds 5L/hour. Requires manual reset after investigation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated grow light photoperiod control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set lights on/off based on astronomical calculations. Add civil twilight compensation (±30 min). Override for minimum DLI targets.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated backup system testing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Test backup systems monthly: switch to backup power 10 min, test backup pumps 5 min, verify sensor failover functionality.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated water treatment regeneration?
output: [STATUS: OK] Regenerate RO membranes when permeate TDS >50ppm or flux drops >20%. Backwash for 30 min, then clean-in-place if needed.
source: Ayers and Westcot 1994 - FAO Irrigation Paper

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated screen position verification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Verify screen position with limit switches at 0%, 50%, 100%. If position sensor differs >5%, recalibrate or flag for maintenance.
source: Bailey et al. 1996 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated air velocity profiling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure air velocity at 9 points (3×3 grid). Adjust fan speeds to achieve uniform distribution (CV <20%). Map monthly.
source: Kacira et al. 2006 - Transactions of ASABE

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated shade deployment hysteresis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy shade at 650 W/m², retract at 550 W/m². Use 100 W/m² hysteresis to prevent cycling on partly cloudy days.
source: Impron et al. 2008 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated irrigation zone rotation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate start sequence daily to balance wear. Zone 1→2→3 on Mon, 2→3→1 on Tue, 3→1→2 on Wed. Prevents pressure drop in same zone.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated root zone temperature differential control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain root zone 2°C warmer than air during fruiting. Use independent heating circuit with substrate temp sensor feedback.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated valve cycling prevention?
output: [STATUS: OK] Implement minimum 5-minute on-time and 3-minute off-time for all valves. Reduces cycling, extends valve life, stabilizes system pressure.
source: Camp et al. 1998 - Water Distribution Systems

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated boiler sequencing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Run boiler 1 as lead until 80% capacity, then stage boiler 2. Rotate lead boiler weekly. Maintain standby boiler at 40°C for quick start.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated nutrient solution mixing sequence?
output: [STATUS: OK] Fill tank 80%, add macro A, mix 5 min, add macro B, mix 5 min, add micros, mix 10 min. Verify EC/pH before release.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for automated irrigation emitter clog detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor pressure differential across filter. If increases >0.3 bar, initiate backwash. Check individual emitters if pressure drops >15%.
source: Nakayama and Bucks 1991 - Water Quality in Drip Systems

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated thermal mass charge/discharge?
output: [STATUS: OK] Charge water tank to 45°C during excess solar gain. Discharge via heat exchanger at night to maintain 18°C minimum air temp.
source: Sethi and Sharma 2010 - Renewable and Sustainable Energy Reviews

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for automated fan belt tension monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor motor current. If increases >10% for same fan speed, alert for belt inspection. Check tension monthly, adjust to manufacturer spec.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated screen wrinkle detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor motor torque during deployment. If exceeds 120% rated, stop and reverse slightly. Alert for manual inspection of binding.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated CO2 purity monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor CO2 purity if using flue gas. Shut off injection if CO2 <95% or NOx detected. Use pure CO2 or scrubbed flue gas only.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated heating pipe cleaning cycle?
output: [STATUS: OK] Flush heating pipes annually. Close zone valves sequentially, flush each circuit at 2× normal flow rate for 30 minutes with descaler.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for automated light sensor shading compensation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install reference sensor in full sun. Compare to canopy sensors. Adjust setpoints if canopy shading reduces light by >20%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated pump pressure optimization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use VFD to maintain target pressure at most distant point. Reduce pump speed when fewer zones active to save energy 15-30%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] High temperature with low humidity. Alert response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Deploy shade screens 100%, open vents fully, activate misting system. High VPD stress detected; reduce crop water stress immediately.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Filter pressure differential reaches 0.8 bar. Action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Initiate automatic backwash cycle immediately. If pressure doesn't normalize after 2 backwashes, alert for manual filter inspection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Drain EC exceeds supply EC by 2.0 mS/cm. Alert action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Critical salt accumulation. Flush substrate with low-EC water immediately. Increase leaching to 40% for next 3 irrigations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] CO2 sensor reads 3000ppm during night. Emergency response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Critical safety alert. Evacuate greenhouse immediately. Open all vents, stop CO2, check for burner malfunction or leak. Ventilate 30 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Three temperature sensors show 5°C variance. Protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Possible stratification or sensor drift. Check physical sensor positions. Increase air circulation. Recalibrate all sensors within 24 hours.
source: Kittas et al. 2005 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Irrigation system runs continuously for 60 minutes. Alert?
output: [STATUS: OK] Probable valve failure or control malfunction. Shut off main irrigation pump. Check valve operation manually. Prevent flooding and water waste.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Supply water EC suddenly increases from 0.4 to 1.8 mS/cm. Response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop irrigation immediately. Switch to backup water source. Check for cross-contamination with fertilizer line or drain water recycling error.
source: Ayers and Westcot 1985 - Water Quality Guidelines

instruction: [STATUS: OK] All vents fail to open during heat event. Emergency protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Switch to manual control. Physically open vents if safe. Activate all cooling: misting, fans, shade. Monitor crop stress every 15 minutes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Nutrient tank pH drops to 3.5 suddenly. Alert action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop all fertigation. Acid overdose detected. Check acid pump for malfunction. Drain tank, remix fresh solution. Test pH controller.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Power outage detected, generators fail to start. Response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Manual intervention required. Open vents mechanically for cooling. Prioritize crop protection: maintain minimum airflow, monitor temperature hourly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate harvest prediction with climate scheduling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use accumulated growing degree days (GDD) to predict harvest timing. Adjust temperature ±2°C to accelerate/delay harvest by 3-5 days as needed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate labor scheduling with environmental conditions?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule labor during optimal climate hours (VPD 0.8-1.2 kPa, temp 20-24°C). Avoid during extreme conditions or when systems at full capacity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate pest trap counts with ventilation strategy?
output: [STATUS: OK] If pest trap counts increase >50%, reduce vent opening by 30% for 7 days. Install insect screens on inlets to prevent entry.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating substrate analysis with fertigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Lab test substrate weekly, adjust feed EC within 24 hours if deviation >0.5 mS/cm. Track trends to predict nutritional needs.
source: De Kreij et al. 1997 - Plant Research International

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate leaf area index with climate control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure LAI monthly. Increase ventilation and reduce humidity setpoint by 5% when LAI >3.0 to prevent disease in dense canopy.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate fruit load monitoring with irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Estimate fruit load kg/m² weekly. Increase irrigation frequency by 1 cycle per day for every 5 kg/m² above 10 kg/m² baseline.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate disease risk models with humidity control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate disease pressure index from temp/RH/leaf wetness. If risk >70%, maintain RH <75% and increase night temp 2°C preventively.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate yield data with setpoint optimization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Track yield kg/m²/week against historical climate data. Use machine learning to identify optimal setpoint combinations for maximum yield.
source: Jung et al. 2020 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate substrate temperature with root health monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain substrate 18-22°C. If root disease detected, increase substrate temp to 22-24°C to boost plant immunity and root regeneration.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What approach for integrating market prices with production timing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Adjust temperature and CO2 to shift harvest ±7 days based on price forecasts. Increase temp 2°C to accelerate, decrease 2°C to delay.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate renewable energy generation with climate control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Schedule energy-intensive operations (lighting, heating) during peak solar generation. Store excess in thermal mass or batteries for later use.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What strategy to integrate plant stress indicators with irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor leaf temperature and stem diameter variation. If stress detected (leaf temp >air temp +2°C), increase irrigation frequency 25%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to integrate air quality sensors with ventilation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor VOCs and particulates. If levels exceed 100 ppb or PM2.5 >50 μg/m³, increase ventilation 50% to improve air quality.
source: Yousefi et al. 2017 - Building and Environment

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What method to integrate pruning schedules with climate adjustment?
output: [STATUS: OK] After pruning, reduce humidity setpoint 5% for 48 hours to promote wound healing. Increase air circulation 20% to prevent disease entry.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What dripper flow rate for tomato irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 2-4 L/hour pressure-compensating drippers for mature tomato plants. Install 2 drippers per plant spaced 15cm apart for uniform root zone wetting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to calculate irrigation duration?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide daily water requirement (3-5L per plant) by dripper flow rate. Typical duration 15-30 minutes per irrigation event, 4-8 events daily.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pressure for drip irrigation system?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 1.0-1.5 bar system pressure for optimal dripper performance. Use pressure regulators ensuring ±0.1 bar uniformity across laterals.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How often to flush drip lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Flush lines weekly for 2-3 minutes at 2 bar pressure. Increase to daily flushing when using organic nutrients or during algae growth periods.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What dripper spacing for container tomatoes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Space drippers 30-40cm apart in substrate slabs or 2 drippers per 10L container. Position 5cm from stem avoiding direct contact.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to detect dripper clogging?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor pressure differential >0.3 bar between line inlet and outlet. Visual inspection shows asymmetric wetting patterns around clogged drippers.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What filtration level for drip emitters?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 120-mesh (130 micron) filtration minimum for standard drippers, 200-mesh (75 micron) for micro-drippers. Pre-filter at 40-mesh for surface water.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to size main irrigation lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate for maximum flow velocity 1.5 m/s in PVC pipes. Use 50mm diameter for 100m growing rows, increase to 75mm for 200m.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What lateral line diameter for drip irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 16mm diameter laterals for rows up to 50m length. Upgrade to 20mm diameter when row length exceeds 50m maintaining pressure uniformity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to prevent algae in drip lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Inject hydrogen peroxide at 50ppm or chlorine at 1-2ppm weekly. Use opaque tubing and avoid light exposure on stored lateral lines.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the optimal leaching fraction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 20-30% drainage for EC control in recirculating systems. Increase to 40% during salt accumulation periods or high EC source water.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to calibrate injection pumps?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure actual injection rate at 3 flow settings comparing to setpoint. Adjust calibration maintaining ±2% accuracy across operating range.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What pump size for 1 hectare greenhouse?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate 50-80 m³/hour capacity for drip irrigation with 3-5L/plant daily requirement. Add 30% safety margin for peak demand periods.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How often to replace drip lines?
output: [STATUS: OK] Replace lateral lines every 2-3 growing seasons or when >10% emitters show reduced flow. Inspect annually for wear and root intrusion.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What's the purpose of air vents in irrigation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install automatic air release valves at high points preventing airlocks. Vent air during system filling and after maintenance for full prime.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to winterize irrigation systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Drain all lines using compressed air at 3 bar maximum pressure. Flush with antifreeze solution for systems that cannot be fully drained.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What filter backwash frequency?
output: [STATUS: OK] Backwash sand filters when pressure differential exceeds 0.5 bar or weekly minimum. Screen filters require daily cleaning during peak season.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to size nutrient tanks?
output: [STATUS: OK] Provide 2-3 days water supply capacity, typically 200-300L per 100m². Use separate A/B concentrate tanks at 100x dilution ratio.
